111.content:
Misty was at the Cerulean gym leader training her water pokemon. Suddenly the was a bright light and she was knocked out.

When she woke up she was tied up in a strange lab. She tryed to get out but the ropes were too tight. Then she noticed all the giant Rs everywhere. She knew that this means team rocket had captured her.

"They must be after the pokemon at the Cerulean gym...but we would they take me along with my pokemon?" Thought Misty.

Then the door opens and....
111.title: Misty... New Team Rocket member?

choices: Follow Misty as she becomes Jesse
Follow Jesse as she becomes Misty
1111.content:
A pair of Team Rocket women come in and take off Mistys' old clothes and put on a uniform that looks just like the one Jesse wares. Picking up Miistys' old clothes they walk into the other room.

Shortly after Jesse, James, and Meowth enter. Misty screams "What are you doing, let me go!". Meowth hopes up onto the table and informs her "We are tired of losing to Ash so we decided to put someone on the inside."

"Whats that got to do with me?" asked Misty.

Laughing "It is going to be you!" Meowth replied.

"That's never going to happen, I never betray Ash!" Misty yelled.

"O we don't need you just your body. See this machine?" says Meowth pointing to a device that looked like a window with lights built into the glass. Misty looked closer and noticed that there where speakers on the right and left side as well. "It is a hypnosis machine and with it you will think your Jesse. Lets stand her up and then take your place on the other side Jesse."

With that Jesse and James flipped the table with Misty on it up to a standing position in front of the machine. Jesse took her position standing on the other side as James and Meowth left the room.

A few minutes after they left Jesse yelled out "Lets get this over with I don't want to stand here all day!" Just then the lights went out and the window in the machine started to swirl with color and light. Then the color let up enough for Misty and Jesse to see each other. Lastly the speakers started to produce a fluctuating hum. This went on for 20 Minutes. By this time Misty was looking at Jesse with a dull glazed to her eyes and a slaking of her jaw. What no one notched was Jesse had a look just like Misty's.

Jamess' voice came over the speakers "5 minutes after the lights come on you will forget everything about who you are." He repeated this about 10 times. "look strait ahead, this is a mirror, it is showing you your true self. Right after 5 minutes you will become this person. You will think like this person. You will act like this person. You will embody everything that it means to be this person." James repeated this 3 more times.

When the lights came on both girls blinked several times. "About time its over." Jesse complained as James and Meowth came into the room. "Quickly get the table down and get out of here Jesse she can't see you when it happens." said Meowth. Jesse went down a hall and into a room were they had put Misty's things to wait.
1111.title: Jesse, James, and Meowth enter

As meowth and james had "a talk with misty" jesse sat down in the hall, and looked at misty's clothes she was tired, and the flashing lights of the machine had exhausted her eyes, she really needed some sleep, and some food, and these tight clothes were really annoying...
As she waited, the lightbulb in the room started to flicker, it was a common thing, the team was not short on money, but giovanni hated to spend it, damn, the uniform was really tight, it felt like wearing someone else's clothes...
She decided to pull of her boots, as they were too hot, and also her gloves, damn, it was real hot here, she really needed some water...
Almost unconsciously, jesse started to look at misty's clothes, sneakers, a light yellow t-shirt, and a pair of short shorts, it seemed very light, and fresh, and the clothes had the smell of pure water
Pure water?, damn, she was getting confused, this might be the reason her clothes were so tight, she might have took another uniform, she definitely had too change... the clothes looked so appealing, damn, the light started to flicker again, she had to wear better clothes, she pulled her skirt off, along with her top, with a gazed look in her eyes, and took off her panties and bra, with the same expressionless face, as she couldn't stop herself from watching the lightbulb...
The lightbulb, its light kinda looked like pikachu using thunderbolt, she loved pikachu, she couldn't wait to see him and ash again
She took some bands and, for no reason, wrapped it around her chest, her C breast didn't seem... natural, like dirt in water, it should be only water... she took her clothes, started with the blue panties, then the white bra, the t-shirt, the shorts, the red braces, and finally, the sneakers
When she finished, she looked at herself in the mirror, she was beautiful, as always but...
"WHHAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAT, what is going on, my hair look horrible, is that pink? i'm sure this is psyduck... she reached her bag, and got a pair of scissors out and started cutting her hair, and coloring it (she was not a natural ginger, but there was no need to tell anyone about it, right? yeah right) when she finished, she took her pokeballs, her bag and put the clothes she found in the room in her bag, a team rocket uniform it seemed, weird, but she could show it to ash as a prank, maybe she'll dress as jesse, anyway, she really had to go out of this pokemon center, she took an elevator, nobody was in it, and so, she left

1532111.content:
Katara had fought bravely with the attack forces of the water tribe and the earth kingdom fighters, however, she did not predict what ought to be predicted, that while cleaning the path, she would become the target for attacks. Though, she did not have much to fear, after all, this was the day of the black sun, and she was the best waterbender in the world, her meeting with hama only reinforced her resolve in mastering water, though, she sometimes felt confused about the extend of her powers, and she worried about what she ought to do with them, surely, a time would come where she'd have to use them, but not today, today, she channeled her energy in circles and spheres, she froze her breath, she imagined spikes everywhere, tentacles, if need be, she felt that she could catch up with aang and the others, but today, she led, because she was needed.

But, still, she a pull towards the battlefield, she wanted to fight, today, she was no healer, after, she could, but not today, the pull was stronger as she glided on ice and water, she was going faster than excepted, she tried to slow down, but she couldn't help herself, she jumped through a window on the second floor of an upcoming tower, bringing only her four waterbags, she used one of them as a tentacle to slow down her fall, and the three others divided into eight spheres, quickly thrown on everything that moved. In her mind, she was already freezing them, she dodged the weak fire punch of an old mustachoied guard, and used her tentacle to hold him by his throat on the wall, she pressed just the right amount for him to lose consciousness, but not enough to die, truly, the most useful thing she learned in the healer's tent.

She felt relaxed, she just took down a full artillery tower, the eclipse would be in another seven minutes, she quickly searched for water outside and inside the building, the trees, the plants, and she took everything, but the restraintson the guards, when they'd wake up, the nation would be on its knees, she'll likely have a medal or something, though toph, sokka, and probably suki would have more, not that she looked for recognition, but she didn't feel very good with being always the one that mattered the least, and though aang kissed her, it annoyed her how much she did for the gaang, and yet, she rarely was thanked, still, when all of the east artillery towers will be taken down, she knew she'd get enough praise for the rest of her days, in this she found solace.

She prepared to make the jump again, feeling the pull stronger even, this time, she did not resist it: she'd crash on the soldier's shadow on the window, the sound of his face being used as an emergency landing should be satisfying, she said, as she advanced her leg to land-kick, or was it kick-land?
but instead of hearing the squishy bwoosh she waited for, but the feeling of going through smoke, only the smoke reformed on her leg, stopping her, and disrupting her balance.

Sand.

She understood it was a trap, but she couldn't move fast enough to unblock her leg, she stood on her toes and she tried to spin enough to seng a water spear at anything that moved, but she felt pressure on her neck, her armpits, the inside of her thighs, her stomach and between her two eyes, something untoubtedly sharp, but manipulated with delicacy and proffessionalism, this was no mercenary, this was...

- Dai li? said katara, as she relaxed her musles, though she did not drop her water balls

A slow clap came from behind her, but also from her front, her sides, in fact, she counted eight different people, if they were all dai-li, and if they all had seen her bend outside... They must have devised their plan quickly, still, knowing who they responded to, she wondered whether it might be more efficient to take four of them down now and die, rather than being handed to ozai or azula.

But before she could ponder her thoughts, a soft voice spoke.

-There is no need to be afraid, we were asked to hold you captive, drop the water in the sand statue, and we just take you with us, we do not go back to the battlefield, so, you give your friends an advantage, deal?
1532111.title: Day of the blue sun part 1

choices: She laid on the bed trying to sleep
At least she'd resist, sleep on the floor !
15321111.content:
It was not like katara to go down this way, but she saw that she wasn't dealing with ordinary dai li members, they had been clever, and their bending was not ordinary, she learned fighting toph that even the driest dirt had water in it, but she did not feel any of it inside the tower or with her captors, if they could block her with sand... even ice wouldn't be enough to fight, she could kill one, but that would only worsen her situation, she thought about making a jump for it in the open, but she felt water fading away behind her, the plants, the air, everything was drying from the moment she entered the tower. She lost, yet, she felt a disturbing sense of pride, at least 8 of the 10th earthbenders were here, the 1st and second being respectively under the mountain breaking a giant metal door, and in omashu being detained in a steel coffin, and the trap was for her, and her only, the trap was well thought, well conceived, and the person who designed it knew her style well, since zuko was way too confident and stupid, it had to be azula, she still blemished thinking about it, but she couldn't see how she could make it alive and well.

-Deal

She slowly pulled the water in the sand, it was then thrown away by the window behind her, then, she felt a cold, smooth grip on her hands, like dust, then, she felt a slight push on it, and she could no longer move her hands, it looked like...

-It's ceramic, only i can bend it said the man behind her, as he made the same moves on her feet

-Normally, it needs to be heatened said katara, hoping she could at least steal the secret for aang and toph

-Yes, but i keep it together by bending it, my friends here help me maintain the charge, that or they are bending the ground outside to turn into sand and heat it

-Heat it?

-Yes, we are the white guard, miss azula thought about the multiples uses of earthbending, and created these techniques, we can form porcelain, glass, heat the ground, charge it with static electricity and so on.

-And yet you tell it to me so freely, why?

The man gave no answer, only an enigmatic smile, approaching her side, he was young, in his early 20's with dusty brown hair and strange goggles on his eyes biggened his thin black eyes. His skin was a deep arylide color behind the googles, but he was lightly taned everywhere else, he wore a white and grey tunic, as did his comrades,
who wer forming a circle around her, next thing she kew, she was falling with the other men, down a tight cavern, she felt herself slowing down, then, she realized the men were hanging from the wall while bending her hand and feet cuffs, she fell on something soft, then, she seemed to gain speed forward, at an alarming speed, everything was going fast, she had no way to know where she was, everything was dark, then, another fall, shorter, then, she felt herself going forward again, a turn on the left, then, she seemed to slow down.

She was dropped in a cell, with soft, silky walls, she felt the cuffs being take away in a swift move, a candel was lighted, and the door closed, she was alone.
The room was 20 feet wide and 30 feet long, the ceiling was 16 meters tall, as she suspected, this was indeed silk on the walls, a large bed at the end of the room, sadly, she couldn't hide under the bed to surprise her captors, the room was escape proof, but comfortable, still, what should she do?
15321111.title: Day of the blue sun, part 2

choices: Someone was waiting, in the shadows
153211111.content:
As katara pondered options, she remembered her father's advice to the boys in the tribe, a long time ago, back at the camp:

"You see, boys, when you hear about war, people talk about honor, about fighting for every bit, about being a hero, said hakoda, but truth is, kids, war is not a brave thing, war is people killing each other to live, or accepting your comrades get killed for you to keep on living, and that ain't no way to win
Tha real way to win is to keep yourself in the best possible shape for da' battles, it's about getting good sleep, it's about having the best armor for running, defending yourself and the others, it's about eating well, it's about being in da mood, it's about believing you can see the next day. But it sure ain't about having the best sword or the best bending possible, proof is, we're on a giant chunk of ice and snow, closer to the moon and to every spiritual energy possible; And yet, our enemy is making his way here in big, noisy ships, with fire benders freezing their hands out here, they have no advantage of surprise, no clever tactic, and no big, honowful battle. What they got is food, varied, not seal cooked with algae and seal grease, they have rice, salted pork and tea, they are comfortably installed, they know if some general in the west won such battle or if their wife and kid are okay, we just don't.
This is why you've got to fight them on every bit you can, anyone can wield a sword, but few men can ration themselves responsibly for weeks, few men can have their beds and their packs tidy, fewer can have their teeth clean and not get any disease, who killed more of us than the fire nation ever did. War is not a battle of courage, of honor of grace, even, it's about which men stay alive at the end. Be sure to be these men, that's all."

Well, at least, katara would be this woman, so, she prepared herself to sleep as long as possible, in the best position possible, ready to face anyone who came through the huge, metallic door. She pondered to herself, though, the reason of her kidnapping was quite blurry, sure, she knew a lot about sokka's plan, but if they wanted to know what was going on, they would be interrogating her already, maybe it was because she trained aang personally, but this huge "sparky boom boom" man, zuko and azula knew about as much as aang's bending as herself. It wasn't because they needed a water bender, there were plenty of those up here, from the north or from the swamp, and they chose the most skilled of them all, while allowing a ridiculously skilled and trained squad to capture her only, and unharmed. So it mans it was either 1: her extraordinary water bending was needed, or 2, the less likely, but one of the few not out of the picture, they wanted her for... Her, just her personality or some discrete quality about her, what could azula see in her that was enough to risk the safety of a nation?

Perhaps, she could uncover that tomorrow, but as for now, sleep would be her prime weapon, as she had no water except the water in her body, and the humidity of the air, that was strangely lacking for an underground cell. She sat on the red mattress, covered with purple, bordeaux, cramoisi, ember, corail colors, embroidered in a motif that was both alike water crashing itself on a seaside cliff, and fire vanishing into thin air, but as she let herself carefully rest on the bed, she felt it move alike water, but could not be, as it would be either the greatest blunder possible, which could not happen under azalea's ruthless command, or a way to escape, which meant a waste of ressources on the battlefield. Inhaling deeply to concentrate, she noticed a deep scent coming from the wobbly mattress, ginger, rose and thyme, and two other scents she could not identify, one who smelled like vapor filled with sugar, and the other smelled like pure water, which smelled of nothing, but this smell of nothing was here, the scent must have come from oils of different kinds, mixed with alcohol to be volatile, but she could bend neither (although she knew a men in the northern water tribe that could've bent the latter, had he been sober enough.

But as much as she liked the smell, it would not help her getting ready for tomorrow, or help anyone gain the war, she undressed to the strict maximum, before finally setting on the oil-bed, and she fell into a deep, strangely warm sleep.


What happened when she woke up ?
153211111.title: A good night's sleep (DOTBS part 3)

1532111112.content:
As katara slowly rose up from the bed, feeling in some sort of danger, like a fly seeing a chameleon in the corner of her eyes, she discerned a figure hidden between two large crimson drapes that hung in the room, not knowing what to do, she slowly got out of the bed, in order to see who it was.
As she was putting on her shoes, she bent what was left of the water she sweated during the night, it was only bigger than a nail, but if she sent it in the right spot, she could stun her adversary, and if the person cried, it could be her ticket home. She approached the form as unconspiciously as she could, faking an interest in the fabrics that decorated the room, until she got to the point where she could almost hear the blinking of the figure just 2 feet on her left side, she breathed deeply, and then.

Bam, she fired her sweatdrop from the tip of her left index, the drop going upwards, aiming for where she thought there might be a head, she felt the drop hit something, she then drew the drapes to see she'd hurt

A dummy?

As she stood there, confused and angry at wasting her single drop of water on a simple sand and paper dummy, she heard a quick sound, like a drumroll repeated over and over again in less than a second. Then hands were in front of her eyes, exercing no pressure, almost touching her skin, but not, she smelt a perfume like the one on the matress, then, a sharp, feminine voice asked playfully:

"Guess who's there?"

Katara tried to duck to at least punch her mystery opponent somewhere, but her elbow moves, then her arms were parred and deflected over and over as she tried to land as much hits as possible, perhaps in a chaotic way, then she stopped, realizing her opponent to be
1532111112.title: A friend

15321111121.content:
-Suki?
Katara backed off, surprised to see the person she'd been fighting was suki, she hadn't seen her in four months, and, for the greater part of this time, she thought she would be in prison, or worse... But here she was, suki wore light fire nation clothes, in shades of red that complimented her pale complexion, she was standing there smiling giddily at katara.
-How? asked katara, shocked, Why? i mean...

-Shhh, responded suki, i'm alright, calm down, you're safe now.

-Did the others rescue you, did they escape, are they on their way?

Katara's mind was racing, suki looked so calm, so confident, how could she be in the fire nation's capital secret prison? Gosh, what should she do? what would aang do? or sokka? Sokka, oh, god, she'd have to tell him, did he know sui was alive? the last months had been hard on him and she feared another yue event, with sokka retreating in his shell the whole time, but now, everything would be fine, and

-Katara, i know you must be, like, thinking really fast about all that's happening, but we kind of need to move out, y'know. said suki, snapping her out of it.

-Yes, let's go, said katara.

Suki took a keyset from her pocket, and started rumagging through it, she opened the door, revealing a dark tunnel that seemed to stretch for miles and miles, they started to run, katara following suki.

-Did you bring any water? asked katara, panting and dehydrated.

-Where we're going, we won't need it.

She didn't understand, did they win the fight? was that why suki was freed? It had to be it, suki should be taking her to a water filled place or something, where she could bend to all her extent, maybe bathe too, she stank that flowery scent on every bit of her clothes, even suki seemed to smell like that.
Corridor after corridor still, they continued to go upwards, in the dry underground air, with the sole light being the occasional spurts of magma on some of the walls, suki was runnig like she was at the beach, syrupping a cold fresh drink, man, she would kill for an ice cube, happily, she wouldn't seem to have to, they were finally at their destination, as suki panted in front of a wooden door, the planks leaving here and there a bright light enter.

-Go in, said suki, looking exhausted, i'll join you later, she's waiting for you

She? katara was puzzled. Did toph finally put her threat into actions, and beat the fire lord with aang? She entered the room, hoping to find the newly crowned melon lord.

Still, she entered through the door, she was briefly blinded by the light, until she was met by...
15321111121.title: Suki?

153211111211.content:
Katara, during her stay at the north pole, once went into a rich merchant's house. The purpose was essentially for her and paku to meet with the eldest southern water tribe woman alive in the north pole, in order to know if there was any technique unique to the southern water, tribe, as she later learned there were in the swamps, in the isles, or in the isolated village where she encountered bloodbending for the first time.

The woman, mother to a successful merchant, had been off her rocker for some time, now, and knew more about squids made of pure water and lights in the sky than about the legendary snow hunting technique recorded in ancient manuals.

However, what katara remembered of the visit were not the ramblings of the hundred year old hag, but how utterly and completely ugly the house was. The merchant had wanted to expose his superior wealth by a show of abundance. The floors were covered in penguin-seal and polar bear dogs furs, the furniture was fire nation redwood and earth kingdom jade, a beautifully intricate scimtar made of elephant wasp horn hung on the wall, and, luxury of luxuries, a fire was perpetually maintained in the living room, where the man made a show of looking as if it was too hot, and if his guests wanted to cool of on the patio (pronounced Patiiiiiiiiio with a gesture of the wrist to accompany the exoticism of the word). Paku and her had an honest laugh at the man soon after their departure, his house, indeed hot, was constantly melting on itself, and ruining every single piece of fancy furniture the man had. Paku had then told her that austerity is the best way of not looking ridiculous.

However, her first glance of the room told her that both men were wrong, the room was everything elegance could mean, the walls were of a homely red with small indents in them, making by an intricate light and shadow play appear two dragons entangled in each other circling the room, an immense indigo rug covered the floor, and katara felt that if a thousand men army were to stomp on it, she would hear but a muffled *bomp* every now and then.

Of course, there were some elements she would not have wanted inside her house, she had never been a fan of redwood furniture, and did not think that princess azula, sitting lazily on her throne (which itself rested on top of a makeshift (by professional earthbender standards) podium, in the shape of an aztec pyramid), her legs dangling from the armrests, eating a branch of grape-lichees, half a dozen of dai-li guards, as well as some elite firebenders, would look good in her living room, but maybe she was not up to date with the wonderful world of home furniture.

Quite stressed, but in fact relieved to face an actual, physical danger, instead of idly wondering why she'd been perfumed to death, katara just stood there, hearing the heavy wooden door behind her shut itself, thinking she heard a snicker from suki just before the *vlam* of the closing door.

"Rude of you not to knock" Said azula, detachedly, fixated on biting a particulary chewy grape-lichee berry, looking into the distance "But then i did not expect that much from you, so i'll forgive you"

Katara knew better than to respond to the taunts of a madwoman, but could not stop herself from throwing a stare full of hatred into azula's eyes.

However, Azula did not seem to want to continue the conversation that much, she was absent-mindedly chewing her fruit, staring at the wall. Katara wondered if she should speak for a whole minute before azula asked "Ever thought about the end of the war?"

"Since i was a child of course" Answered Katara, dumbfounded by the question.

"Yeah, i think about it a lot too" Said Azula, before spitting the fruit seed into the air and burning it with a flick or her wrist "Not anyhting crazy like you imagine i do, like, say, continued azula, mimicking a villainous voice, SITTING ON A THRONE MADE OF THE SKULLS OF MY ENNEMIES , But, like, create museums, build cities, make new roads, standardize writing systems, you know, perhaps even rebuild the southern water tribe"

Was Azula mocking her? Katara had a hard time telling. She did not think it physically possible that truth could be emitted by these particular vocal chords, except maybe in the form of dripping sarcasm.

"Don't think i don't know what you think, girl, you must be like Oh, azula is so evil, she wants to kill everyone, she eats babies, and probably wants to mock me and also somehow make me give up my /Azula then made an obviously fake sob/ Rightful cause, which is like, a 100% right "

Katara looked straight into Azula's face, who at the end of her mimic ended up facing her, and now the two had locked eyes.

"Walk with me" Said Azula, leaping off her throne, i've got something to show you.

The Dai-li men looked as surprised as Katara, but she dismissed them with a flick of the wrist, looking only into katara's eyes, without blinking, and pointed to a door on her left.

Katara followed Azula warily, uncertain of what would happen to her on the other side of that door, just as she wondered earlier what was suki's deal, or as she was uncertain of why suki had led her there.

Once outside, she found herself on the balcony of the fire palace, seemingly in the middle of the city, the balcony seemed to stretch for miles and miles, as did the city below her. She was already thinking of the best way of escaping when she heard azula start monologuing, her back turned to her.

"We're not that different you and i"

"We're everything different"

Azula stopped, her shoulders suddenly hunched, she looked weary, and somehow very sad. "I know what it's like to lose a mother"

Katara suddenly went silent. She was caught off-guard, and did not know how to respond, this time, azula reiterated: "Walk with me", as she started walking towards the left side of the balcony.

Katara followed, curious.

"From as long as i remember, started Azula, i've been... violent. ill-tempered, careless, mean on purpose, and all sorts of things. When i was younger i wasn't very violent, but mother used to tell me i tried to burn my nurse's leg at three months old when the woman accidentally dropped me. But when i was young it was okay, sometimes i played, i had lots of stuff to do, friends, toys, and was very free.

But then, as all little girls, i grew older, bolder. I firebended as good as my brother by age 5, it was a game for me, and it was very fun. Of course, or perhaps not of course, since i do not think it common, my father grew angrier with Zuko, he hoped a lot from his firstborn son, excpected a lot of things from him that never came to fruition.

But what did i care? My dad loved me, my grandad loved me as well, and mother loved me the same, just the same. And zuko pitied himself, and held me for his better...

It was a lot of fun at the time, you know, i didn't think things would end up like that" She said, her voice lightly breaking.

"But life changed, as often in wartime, for the worst. My uncle came back from the war broken by the loss of his son, a disgrace to his nation, and dad took the opportunity to take what he wanted: power, probably by killing my grandfather. Needless to say, family dinners got very awkward after that. Mom became more tired, sadder. I don't think she ever loved dad. Or perhaps she did and that's what made it so very hard to see him like that, furious, manic, detached, sometimes violent in his words. Either way she loved us both very much, and for a time it sufficed.

But then, you forget i was eight years old. Which eight year old does not want attention? I got better at firebending, at being mean, and getting what i wanted. I was so young, you know. So very very young...

I think she saw a lot of him in me. The way she looked at me sometimes... I think this is one of the few advantages you have when you lose your parent, You never know this look of deception in their eyes like you just spit in their faces, and you never see them try to put themselves back together just so that they can scold you, hoping that it'll work this time, just this time.

And one day, she was gone. Poof. I was actually happy. Do you believe it? Dad was happy as well. Very smug he was. Very at peace with himself. Zuko cried a lot. I cried just once, when i learned that she had woken up zuko and not me. And since that day i never cried again.

"The rest is at follows " Continued Azula hurriedly, ignoring Katara behind her who had conjured the will to try and say something nice, but which Azula did not want to hear yet. "My brother, as my dad said PUBLICALLY EMBARASSED ME For speaking out against a general's plan which, by the way, did not work, and cost the lives of 341 of our men, but my dad thought my brother, 13 year old angsty zuko with his voice still cracking, deserved to have half his face burned and then, to spend the rest of his days searching for the avatar, which at the time had been seen more in the opium caves of the fire nation than anywhere else in the world.

I spent the next 3 years training, gaining everyone's affection, my two best friends left the city, one to join the circus, one to follow the trail of war in the colonies. I was alone, and i did my homework, learned how backwater and evil the whole world was, how stupid they all were, how only i and my dad were the very best, like no one ever was.

But i was truly alone then"
153211111211.title: Hey there.

1532111112111.content:
"My dad replaced me with zuko, it was as simple as that, in a way, i did everything he asked of me, i excelled at everything, took interest in a lot of things, i was the best, and i was very happy.

Then came the news, the avatar was back. Zuko discovered him in three year's time, where 3 generations of exiled men and women before him failed, my father was impressed, and his attention shifted away, just a moment, from me to Zuko. I was hurt. So very very hurt, but he did not see it. Never saw it really.

But sure enough, Zuko failed, my dad then sent me to track you down, kill the avatar, his companions, his pet bison, his hand glider and whatnot, and send my brother home for a good ole' scolding, probably making his face symmetrical in the process. I was so happy. I thought i could get what i deserved. I thought i deserved so much. So very much."

At this point, Azula was holding the railing of the balcony, and looking at the town, the sun was setting and the city was as red as ever, the orange shades of the sky reflected in the crescent moon lake, the emberbirds were singing their song of mating, and Katara was waiting. She had been slightly shaken at Azula's story. She had considered the girl at best an hindrance, and at worst their worst enemy. Now she saw Azula for what she had been all along: Human.

It was pretty sad.

"Sometimes i wonder, what might've happened if i'd been firstborn? If Ba Sing Se fell to my uncle and my dad lived a quiet life? If Zuko had not been a whiny pissbaby sometimes" Said Azula, sighing, with a sad, somewhat cynical smile. "I supposed along your journey you asked yourself similar questions, and could not fully answer them"

"Yes" Said Katara, the setting sun casting the shadow of the roof of the covered balcony on her eyes. She often wondered what might've happened, had her mother discovered aang. If Aang never fled. If they'd kept Ba Sing Se. If the Dai Li wasn't the world's congregation for whiny pissbabies.

"What i've been wondering lately is the opposite: If i hadn't had Ty Lee and Main for friends?

They were my first stop when i arrived in the earth kingdom. I like to tell myself that it's because they're the best at what they do, but deep down i know that they bring out the best in me. From what i understand, you grew up in a tiny village, a relic of what the south once was, but with people your age. I'd wager my little kidnapping stunt is the closest you've felt to real loneliness, helplessness. Imagine that eight hundred times over and imagine what i felt like being with my friends.

From here on in, you know the story as well as i do" Concluded Azula, resuming her walk towards the corner of the balcony "I hunted you down, infiltrated Ba Sing Se, Took down the unbreakable city, at 14. I felt like the luckiest girl on earth. I felt oh so happy. I felt i'd won. I'd won. I defeated the avatar. I thought i killed another human being for the first time and it made me happy. I feasted for 2 days afterwards. The best thing about it was that i now had everything i wanted to have. My brother back, but me first. My friends. The praise of an army. The unconditional love of my father. My uncle beaten blue. My enemies fleeing.

It lasted a while.

But then, i realized i hungered for more. I did not know what. I wanted more, and in two week's time, i was brooding, manipulating, sulking around in this big ole' castle. It can get quite boring. I went on vacation but nothing could help me. I felt destroyed from the inside. I was so... Angry.

So very angry, not in the way you, who lost your mother, can be at the fire nation, because the fire nation is here. It exists. It is a concrete reality, but i, i, great one, magnificent one, could not find the thing i yearned for.

And now comes the weird part.

Zuko told me he once screamed at the sky a full hour for thunder to crash down on him, but somehow, not a month ago, i was there" Said she, turning the corner, revealing a spot of burnt wood "The thunder hit me, hit me hard, in ways you could not comprehend."

"Try" Said katara, who was somewhat roped into the story

"Imagine days without eating, because you do not need to. Living on the sea floor because you don't need to breathe. Walking on no legs, and still going forwards"

"You're actually terrible at explaining"

"Hey, we're talking about MY life-changing experience here, i'll ring a bell if i need you to tell me what it feels like to be struck by guano from the sky"

"Guano's still better than this perfume"

"If i had to put what i lived through in simple words so that any 8 year old child around could understand It was as if i lost everything that was me. An old question among enlightenment age philosophers in the fire nation was whether we are our thoughts, our emotions, our actions, every of these, some select few, none of that. To me it was as if i'd lost all anger. I felt open to the world. I guess this is what aang felt in the swamp, with the banyan tree"

"How do you know about that?"

"I emerged, continued Azula, uninterrupted by katara Different, still me, but feeling nothing. For two weeks straight i understood what people told me. I ate, i slept, i talked, but i was... detached somehow. I saw things very differently. I understood myself, you could say. We sort of do take ourselves for granted, and never ask ourselves how we function. I did. I would've been very frightened by what i saw, when i saw it. I would've cried a lot as well, but i didn't.

But weird things started happening. Somehow i felt angry in the presence of my dad. Joyful and cheery in the presence of Ty Lee. Angsty when zuko was besides me at the dinner table. Gloomy in Mai's company. Servile and scared in the company of my servants. I started knowing things i didn't before, and i could sense things very differently, as time passed by.

Your group's earthbender, Toph Beifong, can sense the world through the earth. I realized my getting struck by lightning gave me an innate comprehension of all that is electric. I knew what the nerves of each person were sending, i could hear their thoughts as if i read a book in a foreign language. I could feel what others felt. I knew everyone for what they truly were, it was distressing.

I took a slight vacation afterwards, alone, in a small mountain bunker i made my special earthbenders build. Mostly spent my time reading, medical texts, fire nation history, ethnology, poetry, water nations sociology and everything i'd stolen at Ba Sing Se. The world looked very different in this state. But i was merely apathetic, i stopped to firebend even, because i could not think of a good reason why i needed to practice until perfection. My father grew angry with me. Said he did not recognize me. Said i was better before.

I eventually stumbled upon a text said to have been scavenged in Wan Shi tong's library, like, a thousand years ago. A text older than balls, y'know. It was the manuscript of the blue sun. It told a simple story: a fire nation man, struck by the last lighting bolt before an eclipse, became the ruler of a small island in the northern provinces. His subjects had a total devotion towards him. He wanted to rule over all of the fire nation, but was eventually killed by his very own sister. Tragic, yada yada.

I knew the same thing must've happened to him. He must've been very poor and servile, and suddenly he changed, into an apathetic person, and then into a monster. Or perhaps a conqueror, perhaps he got what he wanted of himself.

I wanted of myself not to be the angry person i was, starved of everything, while having everything. I wanted to become someone i could be proud of, and realized that i had to change my ways.

That's where the powers of the blue sun (Which was the name this ruler long ago gave to that lightning bolt) came into effect. They are powers of perception, yes, but also of control. I could change people in strange ways. Little ways. I could ask them to do things they would have pondered longly before doing, i thought that one of my servants had horrible greasy hair for a whooping 10 minutes and the next morning i saw her shaved completely. My uncle, whom i visited, did not want to drink tea, but asked for coffee. Strange things indeed.

I then tried a step further. I tried to make bigger changes, by manipulating the nerves of people around me. It was simple experimentation at first, but soon i could alter memories, i could make people worship me, or try to kill me. I could give people other people's knowledge. Their memories, their personality. I gave an elderly servant ty lee's fashion sense. I could even trigger hormonal changes.

I finally took what i knew was to be the final step of this journey. I changed my own mind. I took the decisiveness, the wisdom, the tastes, the will, the charm of others, but i stayed myself. I was reborn.

But someone else was reborn too at this time. You may not know this, but my brother fled the capital two days ago, wanting to join the avatar. He whooped my dad's butt, said he had a change of heart, that he understood the true essence of things. That he would restore his honor blah blah blah. I think the fact that he'd been drinking coffee for two months now changed things as well.

As my dad was recovering from his lightning wounds, i sneaked upon him and... emptied him."

"You what now?" Said katara, who was growing more and more scared by the second.

"Technically, he's still alive, he breathes, he eats, and is animated by my lightning, but he no longer has thoughts of his own. The man is dead for me, but he'll be a useful puppet as firelord, and that's it"

"That's monstrous" Said katara, now close to vomiting

"He planned to singlehandedly burn the earth kingdom on sozin comet's arrival, if it makes you feel any better, but yeah, horrible, i agree"

"But what do you want now? Why did you want me here?

Azula just smiled

info.brief_description: Females from various shows hypnotize their rivals!
info.description:
Instead of doing one mind control-based interactive, this interactive focuses on females from various cartoons/comics/anime/games etc. hypnotizing their rivals (Sakura being hypnotized by Ino for example).

Keep the characters In-Character. No overly graphic content.
